page.title: 03RECREATION
page.content:
OSMASTON PARK IS A PRIVATE ESTATE OWNED BY THE WALKER OKEOVER FAMILY FROM OKEOVER HALL,MAPLETON.
ABOUT 3000 PHEASANTS ARE SHOT THERE DURING 12 DAYS EACH YEAR BY INVITED GUESTS.EACH SHOOT IS FOR 8 TO 10'GUNS' WHO PAY Â£13 PER PHEASANT KILLED.5000 PHEASANTS ARE REARED BY 2 GAMEKEEPERS AND RELEASED INTO THE PARK AFTER 8 WEEKS.EACH'GUN'IS ALLOWED TO KEEP 2 BIRDS & THE REST ARE SOLD TO BUTCHERS. 20 TO 25 PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED AS BEATERS TO DRIVE THE BIRDS TOWARDS THE 'GUNS'. THE GAMEKEEPERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROTECTING THE BIRDS AFTER THEIR RELEASE AND THIS THEY DO BY SHOOTING OR TRAPPING FOXES AND OTHER PREDITORS. THEY ALSO PATROL THE ESTATE AT NIGHT TO GUARD AGAINST POACHERS.
